definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: When I adopted my son, Erik, Jerry was almost as exuberant as I was.
sentences.chinese: 當我領養了兒子埃裏克後，塞林格幾乎和我同樣興奮。

sentences.english: The bad news is, you won't be able to adopt the dog.
sentences.chinese: 壞消息是你不能領養那狗了。

sentences.english: Over half never even made it to the adoption center.
sentences.chinese: 一多半甚至不用去領養中心。

sentences.english: I adopted my son from the US foster care system when he was 10-years-old.
sentences.chinese: 我從應用看護體制領養我兒子時，我兒子才10歲。

sentences.english: She finds out that she is pregnant, and then gives the baby up for adoption.
sentences.chinese: 她發現，她已經懷孕，然後給嬰兒供人領養。

sentences.english: After Miao graduates, a new student Guoand his class then adopt the grape.
sentences.chinese: 苗苗畢業了，新同學果果班級接着領養了葡萄。

sentences.english: I want to have my own kids, but also adopt.
sentences.chinese: 我想要有自己的孩子，不過也會領養。

sentences.english: Each year about 80 children are adopted by foreign families from the Huazhou Orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 每年化州孤兒院裏有80位孤兒被外國人領養。

sentences.english: She was forced to have her baby adopted.
sentences.chinese: 她被迫把嬰兒給人領養。

sentences.english: And then we have it and we try to, you know, adopt it out.
sentences.chinese: 然後她被留下了，我們試着領養她。

sentences.english: My mother was adopted when she was four.
sentences.chinese: 我母親四歲時被人領養。

sentences.english: During their divorce, the actress argued for rights to keep Flossie .
sentences.chinese: 當這對夫妻離異時，這位女星贏得弗洛西領養權。

sentences.english: The need for international adoption continues, however.
sentences.chinese: 但對國際領養的需求繼續存在。

sentences.english: A childless couple adopted the half-breed.
sentences.chinese: 一對無子女的夫婦領養了這個混血兒。

sentences.english: New owners have adopted 378 other dogs and cats.
sentences.chinese: 另有378只狗和貓被人領養。

sentences.english: Miao goes to university for register, to see the notice of adopt grapes.
sentences.chinese: 苗苗入學報到，看到學校葡萄領養的通知。

definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
to place in the care of sb (a child, pet etc)/to foster/to board out
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
